segments.label: Examination
segments.content: EXAMINATION: CT abdomen and pelvis with IV contrast

segments.label: Clinical Indication
segments.content: CLINICAL INDICATION: Abdominal pain, rule out acute pathology

segments.label: Comparison
segments.content: COMPARISON: None available

segments.label: Technique
segments.content: TECHNIQUE: Axial images of the abdomen and pelvis were obtained following administration of intravenous contrast material. Coronal and sagittal reformations were performed.

segments.label: Lungs
segments.content: No acute abnormality is seen in the visualized lung bases.

segments.label: Liver
segments.content: The liver is normal in size and contour.

segments.label: Liver
segments.content: There is a 1.2 cm simple-appearing low-attenuation lesion in hepatic segment VII, consistent with a cyst.

segments.label: Gallbladder
segments.content: The gallbladder contains numerous calcified gallstones, compatible with cholelithiasis, without gallbladder wall thickening, pericholecystic fluid, or other sonographic signs of acute cholecystitis.

segments.label: Biliary
segments.content: The common bile duct is non-dilated, measuring approximately 4 mm.

segments.label: Pancreas
segments.content: The pancreas is unremarkable without focal mass or peripancreatic inflammatory stranding.

segments.label: Spleen
segments.content: The spleen appears unremarkable.

segments.label: Adrenal Glands
segments.content: The adrenal glands appear unremarkable.

segments.label: Kidneys
segments.content: A 9 mm simple left renal cyst is noted.

segments.label: Kidneys
segments.content: The kidneys are otherwise unremarkable without hydronephrosis or nephrolithiasis.

segments.label: Bowel
segments.content: There is sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of acute diverticulitis.

segments.label: suffix
segments.content:
1. Cholelithiasis without evidence of acute cholecystitis.
2. Hepatic and renal cysts.
3. Sigmoid diverticulosis without acute diverticulitis.

extractions.extraction_text: EXAMINATION: CT abdomen and pelvis with IV contrast
CLINICAL INDICATION: Abdominal pain, rule out acute pathology
COMPARISON: None available
TECHNIQUE: Axial images of the abdomen and pelvis were obtained following administration of intravenous contrast material. Coronal and sagittal reformations were performed.
No acute abnormality is seen in the visualized lung bases.
The liver is normal in size and contour.
There is a 1.2 cm simple-appearing low-attenuation lesion in hepatic segment VII, consistent with a cyst.
The gallbladder contains numerous calcified gallstones, compatible with cholelithiasis, without gallbladder wall thickening, pericholecystic fluid, or other sonographic signs of acute cholecystitis.
The common bile duct is non-dilated, measuring approximately 4 mm.
The pancreas is unremarkable without focal mass or peripancreatic inflammatory stranding.
The spleen appears unremarkable.
The adrenal glands appear unremarkable.
A 9 mm simple left renal cyst is noted.
The kidneys are otherwise unremarkable without hydronephrosis or nephrolithiasis.
There is sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of acute diverticulitis.

1. Cholelithiasis without evidence of acute cholecystitis.
2. Hepatic and renal cysts.
3. Sigmoid diverticulosis without acute diverticulitis.

sample_abdominal_ct.text:
EXAMINATION:

CT abdomen and pelvis with IV contrast

CLINICAL INDICATION: Abdominal pain, rule out acute pathology

COMPARISON: None available

TECHNIQUE: Axial images of the abdomen and pelvis were obtained following administration of intravenous contrast material. Coronal and sagittal reformations were performed.


FINDINGS:

Lungs: No acute abnormality is seen in the visualized lung bases.

Liver: The liver is normal in size and contour. There is a 1.2 cm simple-appearing low-attenuation lesion in hepatic segment VII, consistent with a cyst.

Gallbladder: The gallbladder contains numerous calcified gallstones, compatible with cholelithiasis, without gallbladder wall thickening, pericholecystic fluid, or other sonographic signs of acute cholecystitis.

Biliary: The common bile duct is non-dilated, measuring approximately 4 mm.

Pancreas: The pancreas is unremarkable without focal mass or peripancreatic inflammatory stranding.

Spleen: The spleen appears unremarkable.

Adrenal Glands: The adrenal glands appear unremarkable.

Kidneys: A 9 mm simple left renal cyst is noted. The kidneys are otherwise unremarkable without hydronephrosis or nephrolithiasis.

Bowel: There is sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of acute diverticulitis.

IMPRESSION:

1. Cholelithiasis without evidence of acute cholecystitis.
2. Hepatic and renal cysts.
3. Sigmoid diverticulosis without acute diverticulitis.

segments.label: Examination
segments.content: Exam: MRI Lumbar Spine

segments.label: Clinical Indication
segments.content: Clinical Indication: Low back pain, radiculopathy

segments.label: Lumbar Spine
segments.content: There is mild degenerative anterolisthesis of L4 on L5.

segments.label: Lumbar Spine
segments.content: The normal lumbar lordosis is otherwise maintained.

segments.label: Lumbar Spine
segments.content: Vertebral body heights are preserved.

segments.label: Bones
segments.content: There is a T1 and T2 hyperintense lesion in the L2 vertebral body consistent with a benign hemangioma.

segments.label: Bones
segments.content: Marrow signal is otherwise unremarkable.

segments.label: Spinal Cord
segments.content: The conus medullaris terminates at a normal level and is unremarkable in signal intensity.

segments.label: Lumbar Spine Levels: L1-L2
segments.content: At L1-L2, there is mild disc desiccation without significant canal or foraminal stenosis.

segments.label: Lumbar Spine Levels: L2-L3
segments.content: At L2-L3, there is mild disc desiccation without significant canal or foraminal stenosis.

segments.label: Lumbar Spine Levels: L3-L4
segments.content: At L3-L4, a shallow posterior disc bulge and mild facet arthropathy result in mild central canal narrowing. The neural foramina are patent.

segments.label: Lumbar Spine Levels: L4-L5
segments.content: At L4-L5, there is advanced disc space narrowing and desiccation. A broad-based posterior disc protrusion with a superimposed left paracentral extrusion severely narrows the central canal and contacts the traversing left S1 nerve root. There is moderate left neural foraminal stenosis.

segments.label: Lumbar Spine Levels: L5-S1
segments.content: At L5-S1, mild disc desiccation is present without significant canal or foraminal stenosis.

segments.label: Paraspinal Soft Tissues
segments.content: The paraspinal soft tissues are unremarkable.

segments.label: suffix
segments.content:
1. Severe L4-L5 disc protrusion with superimposed left paracentral extrusion, resulting in severe central canal narrowing and contact with the left S1 nerve root.
2. Multilevel degenerative disc disease, most advanced at L4-L5.
3. Benign hemangioma in L2 vertebral body.

extractions.extraction_text: Exam: MRI Lumbar Spine
Clinical Indication: Low back pain, radiculopathy
There is mild degenerative anterolisthesis of L4 on L5.
The normal lumbar lordosis is otherwise maintained.
Vertebral body heights are preserved.
There is a T1 and T2 hyperintense lesion in the L2 vertebral body consistent with a benign hemangioma.
Marrow signal is otherwise unremarkable.
The conus medullaris terminates at a normal level and is unremarkable in signal intensity.
At L1-L2, there is mild disc desiccation without significant canal or foraminal stenosis.
At L2-L3, there is mild disc desiccation without significant canal or foraminal stenosis.
At L3-L4, a shallow posterior disc bulge and mild facet arthropathy result in mild central canal narrowing. The neural foramina are patent.

At L4-L5, there is advanced disc space narrowing and desiccation. A broad-based posterior disc protrusion with a superimposed left paracentral extrusion severely narrows the central canal and contacts the traversing left S1 nerve root. There is moderate left neural foraminal stenosis.
At L5-S1, mild disc desiccation is present without significant canal or foraminal stenosis.
The paraspinal soft tissues are unremarkable.

1. Severe L4-L5 disc protrusion with superimposed left paracentral extrusion, resulting in severe central canal narrowing and contact with the left S1 nerve root.
2. Multilevel degenerative disc disease, most advanced at L4-L5.
3. Benign hemangioma in L2 vertebral body.

sample_lumbar_spine_mri.text:
EXAMINATION:

MRI Lumbar Spine

Clinical Indication: Low back pain, radiculopathy


FINDINGS:

Lumbar Spine: There is mild degenerative anterolisthesis of L4 on L5. The normal lumbar lordosis is otherwise maintained. Vertebral body heights are preserved.

Bones: There is a T1 and T2 hyperintense lesion in the L2 vertebral body consistent with a benign hemangioma. Marrow signal is otherwise unremarkable.

Spinal Cord: The conus medullaris terminates at a normal level and is unremarkable in signal intensity.

Lumbar Spine Levels: L1-L2: At L1-L2, there is mild disc desiccation without significant canal or foraminal stenosis.

Lumbar Spine Levels: L2-L3: At L2-L3, there is mild disc desiccation without significant canal or foraminal stenosis.

Lumbar Spine Levels: L3-L4: At L3-L4, a shallow posterior disc bulge and mild facet arthropathy result in mild central canal narrowing. The neural foramina are patent.

Lumbar Spine Levels: L4-L5: At L4-L5, there is advanced disc space narrowing and desiccation. A broad-based posterior disc protrusion with a superimposed left paracentral extrusion severely narrows the central canal and contacts the traversing left S1 nerve root. There is moderate left neural foraminal stenosis.

Lumbar Spine Levels: L5-S1: At L5-S1, mild disc desiccation is present without significant canal or foraminal stenosis.

Paraspinal Soft Tissues: The paraspinal soft tissues are unremarkable.

IMPRESSION:

1. Severe L4-L5 disc protrusion with superimposed left paracentral extrusion, resulting in severe central canal narrowing and contact with the left S1 nerve root.
2. Multilevel degenerative disc disease, most advanced at L4-L5.
3. Benign hemangioma in L2 vertebral body.

segments.label: Rotator Cuff
segments.content: A full-thickness, full-width tear of the supraspinatus tendon is present, with the torn tendon end retracted approximately 2 cm medially to the level of the glenoid rim.

segments.label: Rotator Cuff
segments.content: There is moderate fatty infiltration and atrophy of the supraspinatus muscle.

segments.label: Rotator Cuff
segments.content: The infraspinatus, teres minor, and subscapularis tendons and muscles appear intact.

segments.label: Joint Space/Capsule
segments.content: There is a moderate joint effusion with synovial thickening.

segments.label: Glenoid Labrum
segments.content: The glenoid labrum shows a small superior labral tear.

segments.label: Biceps Tendon
segments.content: The biceps tendon is intact and properly positioned within the bicipital groove.

segments.label: Acromioclavicular Joint
segments.content: The acromioclavicular joint shows mild degenerative changes with small osteophytes but no significant narrowing.

extractions.extraction_text: A full-thickness, full-width tear of the supraspinatus tendon is present, with the torn tendon end retracted approximately 2 cm medially to the level of the glenoid rim.
There is moderate fatty infiltration and atrophy of the supraspinatus muscle.
The infraspinatus, teres minor, and subscapularis tendons and muscles appear intact.
There is a moderate joint effusion with synovial thickening.
The glenoid labrum shows a small superior labral tear.
The biceps tendon is intact and properly positioned within the bicipital groove.
The acromioclavicular joint shows mild degenerative changes with small osteophytes but no significant narrowing.

sample_shoulder_mri.text:
FINDINGS:

Rotator Cuff: A full-thickness, full-width tear of the supraspinatus tendon is present, with the torn tendon end retracted approximately 2 cm medially to the level of the glenoid rim. There is moderate fatty infiltration and atrophy of the supraspinatus muscle. The infraspinatus, teres minor, and subscapularis tendons and muscles appear intact.

Joint Space/Capsule: There is a moderate joint effusion with synovial thickening.

Glenoid Labrum: The glenoid labrum shows a small superior labral tear.

Biceps Tendon: The biceps tendon is intact and properly positioned within the bicipital groove.

Acromioclavicular Joint: The acromioclavicular joint shows mild degenerative changes with small osteophytes but no significant narrowing.

segments.label: Examination
segments.content: EXAMINATION: MRI abdomen without and with gadolinium contrast

segments.label: Clinical Indication
segments.content: CLINICAL INDICATION: Polycystic kidney disease with suspected cyst infection, flank pain, fever

segments.label: Comparison
segments.content: COMPARISON: CT abdomen from 3 months ago

segments.label: Technique
segments.content: TECHNIQUE: Axial and coronal T1-weighted, T2-weighted, and post-gadolinium images were obtained.

segments.label: Kidneys
segments.content: Both kidneys are markedly enlarged. The right kidney measures 18.2 cm and the left kidney measures 17.8 cm in length.

segments.label: Kidneys
segments.content: Innumerable thin-walled cysts of varying sizes are present throughout both kidneys, consistent with autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease.

segments.label: Kidneys
segments.content: Several cysts demonstrate T1 hyperintensity consistent with hemorrhagic or proteinaceous content, particularly a 4.2 cm cyst in the right upper pole and a 3.1 cm cyst in the left mid-pole.

segments.label: Kidneys
segments.content: A complex 5.8 cm cyst in the left lower pole demonstrates thick irregular walls, internal septations, and rim enhancement following contrast administration, highly suspicious for an infected cyst.

segments.label: Kidneys
segments.content: Surrounding perinephric inflammatory stranding is present.

segments.label: Kidneys
segments.content: An additional 2.8 cm cyst in the right lower pole shows similar findings concerning for secondary infection.

segments.label: Kidneys
segments.content: No hydronephrosis is identified despite the numerous cysts.

segments.label: Liver
segments.content: Multiple hepatic cysts are noted, the largest measuring 3.4 cm in segment IV.

segments.label: Liver
segments.content: The liver is otherwise normal in signal intensity and enhancement pattern.

segments.label: Spleen
segments.content: The spleen appears unremarkable.

segments.label: Pancreas
segments.content: The pancreas appears unremarkable.

segments.label: Adrenal Glands
segments.content: The adrenal glands appear unremarkable.

segments.label: Abdomen/Pelvis
segments.content: There is mild ascites in the pelvis.

segments.label: suffix
segments.content:
1. Autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease with bilateral renal enlargement and innumerable cysts.
2. Probable infected cysts in the left lower pole (5.8 cm) and right lower pole (2.8 cm) with surrounding inflammatory changes.
3. Multiple hemorrhagic cysts bilaterally.
4. Multiple hepatic cysts.
5. Mild ascites.

extractions.extraction_text: EXAMINATION: MRI abdomen without and with gadolinium contrast
CLINICAL INDICATION: Polycystic kidney disease with suspected cyst infection, flank pain, fever
COMPARISON: CT abdomen from 3 months ago
TECHNIQUE: Axial and coronal T1-weighted, T2-weighted, and post-gadolinium images were obtained.
Both kidneys are markedly enlarged. The right kidney measures 18.2 cm and the left kidney measures 17.8 cm in length.
Innumerable thin-walled cysts of varying sizes are present throughout both kidneys, consistent with autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease.
Several cysts demonstrate T1 hyperintensity consistent with hemorrhagic or proteinaceous content, particularly a 4.2 cm cyst in the right upper pole and a 3.1 cm cyst in the left mid-pole.
A complex 5.8 cm cyst in the left lower pole demonstrates thick irregular walls, internal septations, and rim enhancement following contrast administration, highly suspicious for an infected cyst.
Surrounding perinephric inflammatory stranding is present.
An additional 2.8 cm cyst in the right lower pole shows similar findings concerning for secondary infection.
Multiple hepatic cysts are noted, the largest measuring 3.4 cm in segment IV.
The liver is otherwise normal in signal intensity and enhancement pattern.
The spleen appears unremarkable.
The pancreas appears unremarkable.
The adrenal glands appear unremarkable.
There is mild ascites in the pelvis.
No hydronephrosis is identified despite the numerous cysts.

1. Autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease with bilateral renal enlargement and innumerable cysts.
2. Probable infected cysts in the left lower pole (5.8 cm) and right lower pole (2.8 cm) with surrounding inflammatory changes.
3. Multiple hemorrhagic cysts bilaterally.
4. Multiple hepatic cysts.
5. Mild ascites.

sample_abdominal_mri_pkd.text:
EXAMINATION:

MRI abdomen without and with gadolinium contrast

CLINICAL INDICATION: Polycystic kidney disease with suspected cyst infection, flank pain, fever

COMPARISON: CT abdomen from 3 months ago

TECHNIQUE: Axial and coronal T1-weighted, T2-weighted, and post-gadolinium images were obtained.


FINDINGS:

Kidneys: Both kidneys are markedly enlarged. The right kidney measures 18.2 cm and the left kidney measures 17.8 cm in length. Innumerable thin-walled cysts of varying sizes are present throughout both kidneys, consistent with autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease. Several cysts demonstrate T1 hyperintensity consistent with hemorrhagic or proteinaceous content, particularly a 4.2 cm cyst in the right upper pole and a 3.1 cm cyst in the left mid-pole. A complex 5.8 cm cyst in the left lower pole demonstrates thick irregular walls, internal septations, and rim enhancement following contrast administration, highly suspicious for an infected cyst. Surrounding perinephric inflammatory stranding is present. An additional 2.8 cm cyst in the right lower pole shows similar findings concerning for secondary infection. No hydronephrosis is identified despite the numerous cysts.

Liver: Multiple hepatic cysts are noted, the largest measuring 3.4 cm in segment IV. The liver is otherwise normal in signal intensity and enhancement pattern.

Spleen: The spleen appears unremarkable.

Pancreas: The pancreas appears unremarkable.

Adrenal Glands: The adrenal glands appear unremarkable.

Abdomen/Pelvis: There is mild ascites in the pelvis.

IMPRESSION:

1. Autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease with bilateral renal enlargement and innumerable cysts.
2. Probable infected cysts in the left lower pole (5.8 cm) and right lower pole (2.8 cm) with surrounding inflammatory changes.
3. Multiple hemorrhagic cysts bilaterally.
4. Multiple hepatic cysts.
5. Mild ascites.

segments.label: Joint
segments.content: There is a small joint effusion.

segments.label: Cartilage
segments.content: Diffuse thinning of the articular cartilage is noted at the weight-bearing superior acetabulum and femoral head, with near full-thickness loss anterosuperiorly.

segments.label: Labrum
segments.content: A degenerative labral tear is present at the anterosuperior acetabulum.

segments.label: Joint Capsule
segments.content: The joint capsule shows mild thickening.

segments.label: Bones
segments.content: Moderate subchondral bone marrow edema is seen in the femoral head and acetabulum.

segments.label: Bones
segments.content: Small subchondral cysts are noted in the superior acetabulum.

segments.label: Tendons
segments.content: The hip abductor tendons show signal alteration consistent with tendinosis, and there is a partial-thickness tear of the gluteus medius tendon at its greater trochanteric insertion.

segments.label: suffix
segments.content:
1. Moderate to severe osteoarthritis with cartilage loss and subchondral changes.
2. Anterosuperior labral tear.
3. Partial-thickness gluteus medius tendon tear with tendinosis.

extractions.extraction_text: There is a small joint effusion.
Diffuse thinning of the articular cartilage is noted at the weight-bearing superior acetabulum and femoral head, with near full-thickness loss anterosuperiorly.
A degenerative labral tear is present at the anterosuperior acetabulum.
The joint capsule shows mild thickening.
Moderate subchondral bone marrow edema is seen in the femoral head and acetabulum.
Small subchondral cysts are noted in the superior acetabulum.
The hip abductor tendons show signal alteration consistent with tendinosis, and there is a partial-thickness tear of the gluteus medius tendon at its greater trochanteric insertion.

1. Moderate to severe osteoarthritis with cartilage loss and subchondral changes.
2. Anterosuperior labral tear.
3. Partial-thickness gluteus medius tendon tear with tendinosis.

sample_hip_mri.text:
FINDINGS:

Joint: There is a small joint effusion.

Cartilage: Diffuse thinning of the articular cartilage is noted at the weight-bearing superior acetabulum and femoral head, with near full-thickness loss anterosuperiorly.

Labrum: A degenerative labral tear is present at the anterosuperior acetabulum.

Joint Capsule: The joint capsule shows mild thickening.

Bones: Moderate subchondral bone marrow edema is seen in the femoral head and acetabulum. Small subchondral cysts are noted in the superior acetabulum.

Tendons: The hip abductor tendons show signal alteration consistent with tendinosis, and there is a partial-thickness tear of the gluteus medius tendon at its greater trochanteric insertion.

IMPRESSION:

1. Moderate to severe osteoarthritis with cartilage loss and subchondral changes.
2. Anterosuperior labral tear.
3. Partial-thickness gluteus medius tendon tear with tendinosis.

sample_chest_xray.text:
EXAMINATION:

Chest Radiograph


FINDINGS:

Heart: The cardiac silhouette is normal in size and contour.

Mediastinum: The mediastinal contours are within normal limits.

Lungs: There is a 8 mm well-circumscribed nodule in the right upper lobe. The remainder of the lungs are clear without consolidation, pneumothorax, or pleural effusion.

Vasculature: The pulmonary vasculature appears normal.

Bones: No acute bony abnormalities are identified.

segments.label: Examination
segments.content: EXAMINATION: CT angiography of the chest for pulmonary embolism

segments.label: Clinical Indication
segments.content: CLINICAL INDICATION: Shortness of breath, chest pain, elevated D-dimer, rule out pulmonary embolism

segments.label: Comparison
segments.content: COMPARISON: Chest X-ray from 2 days ago

segments.label: Technique
segments.content: TECHNIQUE: Axial CT images of the chest were obtained following rapid intravenous administration of iodinated contrast material. Images were reconstructed in axial, coronal, and sagittal planes with MIP and VRT reformations.

segments.label: Pulmonary Vasculature
segments.content: There are multiple filling defects consistent with acute pulmonary emboli involving the right main pulmonary artery extending into the right upper and middle lobe segmental branches. Additional smaller emboli are present in the left lower lobe subsegmental arteries.

segments.label: Pulmonary Vasculature
segments.content: The main pulmonary artery is mildly dilated, measuring 3.2 cm in diameter.

segments.label: Heart
segments.content: There is mild right heart strain with flattening of the interventricular septum and enlargement of the right ventricle.

segments.label: Heart
segments.content: No evidence of right heart failure or pericardial effusion.

segments.label: Lungs
segments.content: The lungs show mild bilateral lower lobe atelectasis.

segments.label: Lungs
segments.content: No consolidation or pneumothorax is identified.

segments.label: Pleura
segments.content: Small bilateral pleural effusions are present.

segments.label: Mediastinum
segments.content: The mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes are not enlarged.

segments.label: Mediastinum
segments.content: The aorta and great vessels appear normal.

segments.label: Abdomen
segments.content: The visualized portions of the upper abdomen are unremarkable.

segments.label: Bones
segments.content: No acute bony abnormalities are identified.

segments.label: suffix
segments.content:
1. Acute pulmonary emboli involving the right main, upper and middle lobe segmental arteries, and left lower lobe subsegmental arteries.
2. Mild pulmonary hypertension with right heart strain.
3. Small bilateral pleural effusions and bilateral lower lobe atelectasis.

extractions.extraction_text: EXAMINATION: CT angiography of the chest for pulmonary embolism
CLINICAL INDICATION: Shortness of breath, chest pain, elevated D-dimer, rule out pulmonary embolism
COMPARISON: Chest X-ray from 2 days ago

TECHNIQUE: Axial CT images of the chest were obtained following rapid intravenous administration of iodinated contrast material. Images were reconstructed in axial, coronal, and sagittal planes with MIP and VRT reformations.

There are multiple filling defects consistent with acute pulmonary emboli involving the right main pulmonary artery extending into the right upper and middle lobe segmental branches. Additional smaller emboli are present in the left lower lobe subsegmental arteries.
The main pulmonary artery is mildly dilated, measuring 3.2 cm in diameter.
There is mild right heart strain with flattening of the interventricular septum and enlargement of the right ventricle.
No evidence of right heart failure or pericardial effusion.
The lungs show mild bilateral lower lobe atelectasis.
Small bilateral pleural effusions are present.
No consolidation or pneumothorax is identified.
The mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes are not enlarged.
The aorta and great vessels appear normal.
The visualized portions of the upper abdomen are unremarkable.
No acute bony abnormalities are identified.

1. Acute pulmonary emboli involving the right main, upper and middle lobe segmental arteries, and left lower lobe subsegmental arteries.
2. Mild pulmonary hypertension with right heart strain.
3. Small bilateral pleural effusions and bilateral lower lobe atelectasis.

sample_cta_pulmonary_embolus.text:
EXAMINATION:

CT angiography of the chest for pulmonary embolism

CLINICAL INDICATION: Shortness of breath, chest pain, elevated D-dimer, rule out pulmonary embolism

COMPARISON: Chest X-ray from 2 days ago

TECHNIQUE: Axial CT images of the chest were obtained following rapid intravenous administration of iodinated contrast material. Images were reconstructed in axial, coronal, and sagittal planes with MIP and VRT reformations.


FINDINGS:

Pulmonary Vasculature: There are multiple filling defects consistent with acute pulmonary emboli involving the right main pulmonary artery extending into the right upper and middle lobe segmental branches. Additional smaller emboli are present in the left lower lobe subsegmental arteries. The main pulmonary artery is mildly dilated, measuring 3.2 cm in diameter.

Heart: There is mild right heart strain with flattening of the interventricular septum and enlargement of the right ventricle. No evidence of right heart failure or pericardial effusion.

Lungs: The lungs show mild bilateral lower lobe atelectasis. No consolidation or pneumothorax is identified.

Pleura: Small bilateral pleural effusions are present.

Mediastinum: The mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes are not enlarged. The aorta and great vessels appear normal.

Abdomen: The visualized portions of the upper abdomen are unremarkable.

Bones: No acute bony abnormalities are identified.

IMPRESSION:

1. Acute pulmonary emboli involving the right main, upper and middle lobe segmental arteries, and left lower lobe subsegmental arteries.
2. Mild pulmonary hypertension with right heart strain.
3. Small bilateral pleural effusions and bilateral lower lobe atelectasis.

segments.label: Examination
segments.content: EXAMINATION: Ultrasound of the abdomen

segments.label: Clinical Indication
segments.content: CLINICAL INDICATION: Right upper quadrant pain, abnormal liver function tests

segments.label: Comparison
segments.content: COMPARISON: None available

segments.label: Technique
segments.content: TECHNIQUE: Real-time ultrasound examination of the abdomen was performed using a curved array transducer. Multiple images were obtained in sagittal, transverse, and oblique planes.

segments.label: Liver
segments.content: The liver is normal in size measuring 15.2 cm in the midclavicular line.

segments.label: Liver
segments.content: The hepatic parenchyma demonstrates increased echogenicity consistent with fatty infiltration.

segments.label: Liver
segments.content: There is a well-defined hyperechoic lesion in the right hepatic lobe measuring 2.1 x 1.8 cm, consistent with a hemangioma.

segments.label: Liver
segments.content: No focal hepatic masses or intrahepatic biliary dilatation is identified.

segments.label: Liver
segments.content: Portal vein flow is normal on Doppler evaluation.

segments.label: Gallbladder
segments.content: The gallbladder is distended and contains multiple echogenic foci with posterior acoustic shadowing, consistent with cholelithiasis. The largest stone measures approximately 1.5 cm.

segments.label: Gallbladder
segments.content: The gallbladder wall measures 2 mm in thickness, which is within normal limits.

segments.label: Gallbladder
segments.content: No pericholecystic fluid is identified.

segments.label: Biliary
segments.content: Common bile duct measures 4 mm, which is normal.

segments.label: Pancreas
segments.content: The visualized portions of the pancreatic head and body appear normal in echogenicity and size. The pancreatic duct is not dilated.

segments.label: Kidneys
segments.content: The right kidney measures 10.8 cm and the left kidney measures 11.1 cm. Both kidneys demonstrate normal cortical echogenicity and corticomedullary differentiation. No hydronephrosis, stones, or masses are identified.

segments.label: Spleen
segments.content: The spleen is normal in size and echogenicity, measuring 10.2 cm in length.

segments.label: suffix
segments.content:
1. Cholelithiasis without evidence of acute cholecystitis.
2. Hepatic steatosis (fatty liver).
3. 2.1 cm hepatic hemangioma in the right lobe.
4. Normal kidneys, spleen, and visualized pancreas.

extractions.extraction_text: EXAMINATION: Ultrasound of the abdomen
CLINICAL INDICATION: Right upper quadrant pain, abnormal liver function tests
COMPARISON: None available
TECHNIQUE: Real-time ultrasound examination of the abdomen was performed using a curved array transducer. Multiple images were obtained in sagittal, transverse, and oblique planes.
The liver is normal in size measuring 15.2 cm in the midclavicular line.
The hepatic parenchyma demonstrates increased echogenicity consistent with fatty infiltration.
There is a well-defined hyperechoic lesion in the right hepatic lobe measuring 2.1 x 1.8 cm, consistent with a hemangioma.
No focal hepatic masses or intrahepatic biliary dilatation is identified.
Portal vein flow is normal on Doppler evaluation.
The gallbladder is distended and contains multiple echogenic foci with posterior acoustic shadowing, consistent with cholelithiasis. The largest stone measures approximately 1.5 cm.
The gallbladder wall measures 2 mm in thickness, which is within normal limits.
No pericholecystic fluid is identified.
Common bile duct measures 4 mm, which is normal.
The visualized portions of the pancreatic head and body appear normal in echogenicity and size. The pancreatic duct is not dilated.

The right kidney measures 10.8 cm and the left kidney measures 11.1 cm. Both kidneys demonstrate normal cortical echogenicity and corticomedullary differentiation. No hydronephrosis, stones, or masses are identified.
The spleen is normal in size and echogenicity, measuring 10.2 cm in length.

1. Cholelithiasis without evidence of acute cholecystitis.
2. Hepatic steatosis (fatty liver).
3. 2.1 cm hepatic hemangioma in the right lobe.
4. Normal kidneys, spleen, and visualized pancreas.

sample_abdominal_ultrasound.text:
EXAMINATION:

Ultrasound of the abdomen

CLINICAL INDICATION: Right upper quadrant pain, abnormal liver function tests

COMPARISON: None available

TECHNIQUE: Real-time ultrasound examination of the abdomen was performed using a curved array transducer. Multiple images were obtained in sagittal, transverse, and oblique planes.


FINDINGS:

Liver: The liver is normal in size measuring 15.2 cm in the midclavicular line. The hepatic parenchyma demonstrates increased echogenicity consistent with fatty infiltration. There is a well-defined hyperechoic lesion in the right hepatic lobe measuring 2.1 x 1.8 cm, consistent with a hemangioma. No focal hepatic masses or intrahepatic biliary dilatation is identified. Portal vein flow is normal on Doppler evaluation.

Gallbladder: The gallbladder is distended and contains multiple echogenic foci with posterior acoustic shadowing, consistent with cholelithiasis. The largest stone measures approximately 1.5 cm. The gallbladder wall measures 2 mm in thickness, which is within normal limits. No pericholecystic fluid is identified.

Biliary: Common bile duct measures 4 mm, which is normal.

Pancreas: The visualized portions of the pancreatic head and body appear normal in echogenicity and size. The pancreatic duct is not dilated.

Kidneys: The right kidney measures 10.8 cm and the left kidney measures 11.1 cm. Both kidneys demonstrate normal cortical echogenicity and corticomedullary differentiation. No hydronephrosis, stones, or masses are identified.

Spleen: The spleen is normal in size and echogenicity, measuring 10.2 cm in length.

IMPRESSION:

1. Cholelithiasis without evidence of acute cholecystitis.
2. Hepatic steatosis (fatty liver).
3. 2.1 cm hepatic hemangioma in the right lobe.
4. Normal kidneys, spleen, and visualized pancreas.

segments.label: Examination
segments.content: MRI Cervical Spine:

segments.label: Comparison
segments.content: Comparison: MRI cervical spine dated 6 months ago

segments.label: Cervical Spine
segments.content: The cervical lordosis is maintained. Vertebral body heights and alignment are preserved.

segments.label: Spinal Cord
segments.content: The spinal cord demonstrates normal signal intensity throughout its visualized extent.

segments.label: Cervical Spine Levels: C3-C4
segments.content: At C3-C4, there is mild disc desiccation without significant canal narrowing.

segments.label: Cervical Spine Levels: C4-C5
segments.content: At C4-C5, a small posterior disc osteophyte complex results in mild central canal narrowing. The neural foramina remain patent.

segments.label: Cervical Spine Levels: C5-C6
segments.content: At C5-C6, there is moderate disc space narrowing with a broad-based posterior disc bulge and bilateral uncinate spurring, causing mild to moderate bilateral neural foraminal narrowing.

segments.label: Cervical Spine Levels: C6-C7
segments.content: At C6-C7, mild disc desiccation is present without significant stenosis.

segments.label: Paraspinal Soft Tissues
segments.content: The prevertebral soft tissues are unremarkable.

segments.label: suffix
segments.content:
1. Multilevel cervical spondylosis, most pronounced at C5-C6.
2. Mild to moderate bilateral C5-C6 neural foraminal narrowing.
3. No spinal cord compression or significant central canal stenosis.

extractions.extraction_text: MRI Cervical Spine:
Comparison: MRI cervical spine dated 6 months ago
The cervical lordosis is maintained. Vertebral body heights and alignment are preserved.
The spinal cord demonstrates normal signal intensity throughout its visualized extent.
At C3-C4, there is mild disc desiccation without significant canal narrowing.
At C4-C5, a small posterior disc osteophyte complex results in mild central canal narrowing. The neural foramina remain patent.
At C5-C6, there is moderate disc space narrowing with a broad-based posterior disc bulge and bilateral uncinate spurring, causing mild to moderate bilateral neural foraminal narrowing.
At C6-C7, mild disc desiccation is present without significant stenosis.
The prevertebral soft tissues are unremarkable.

1. Multilevel cervical spondylosis, most pronounced at C5-C6.
2. Mild to moderate bilateral C5-C6 neural foraminal narrowing.
3. No spinal cord compression or significant central canal stenosis.

sample_cervical_spine_mri.text:
EXAMINATION:

MRI Cervical Spine:

Comparison: MRI cervical spine dated 6 months ago


FINDINGS:

Cervical Spine: The cervical lordosis is maintained. Vertebral body heights and alignment are preserved.

Spinal Cord: The spinal cord demonstrates normal signal intensity throughout its visualized extent.

Cervical Spine Levels: C3-C4: At C3-C4, there is mild disc desiccation without significant canal narrowing.

Cervical Spine Levels: C4-C5: At C4-C5, a small posterior disc osteophyte complex results in mild central canal narrowing. The neural foramina remain patent.

Cervical Spine Levels: C5-C6: At C5-C6, there is moderate disc space narrowing with a broad-based posterior disc bulge and bilateral uncinate spurring, causing mild to moderate bilateral neural foraminal narrowing.

Cervical Spine Levels: C6-C7: At C6-C7, mild disc desiccation is present without significant stenosis.

Paraspinal Soft Tissues: The prevertebral soft tissues are unremarkable.

IMPRESSION:

1. Multilevel cervical spondylosis, most pronounced at C5-C6.
2. Mild to moderate bilateral C5-C6 neural foraminal narrowing.
3. No spinal cord compression or significant central canal stenosis.

segments.label: Examination
segments.content: EXAMINATION: Whole-body fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) PET/CT

segments.label: Clinical Indication
segments.content: CLINICAL INDICATION: Staging of newly diagnosed non-small-cell lung carcinoma (NSCLC)

segments.label: Comparison
segments.content: COMPARISON: None available

segments.label: Technique
segments.content: TECHNIQUE: Following a 60-minute uptake period after intravenous administration of 12 mCi of FDG, low-dose non-contrast CT images were obtained for attenuation correction and anatomic localization, followed by emission PET images from the skull base to mid-thigh.

segments.label: Lungs
segments.content: A 3.1 cm spiculated mass in the right upper lobe demonstrates intense FDG uptake (SUVmax 12.4).

segments.label: Mediastinum/Hilar
segments.content: Ipsilateral mediastinal (station 4R) lymph node measuring 1.2 cm shows increased activity (SUVmax 6.8).

segments.label: Mediastinum/Hilar
segments.content: No contralateral mediastinal or hilar hypermetabolic nodes.

segments.label: Bones
segments.content: Multiple focal areas of increased FDG uptake are seen in the axial and appendicular skeleton corresponding to sclerotic lesions on CT, compatible with osseous metastases (largest in right iliac bone, SUVmax 9.1).

segments.label: Liver
segments.content: No abnormal activity in the liver.

segments.label: Adrenal Glands
segments.content: No abnormal activity in the adrenal glands.

segments.label: Brain
segments.content: No abnormal activity in the brain.

segments.label: Heart
segments.content: Physiologic tracer distribution in myocardium.

segments.label: Kidneys
segments.content: Physiologic tracer distribution in kidneys.

segments.label: Urinary Bladder
segments.content: Physiologic tracer distribution in urinary bladder.

segments.label: suffix
segments.content:
1. FDG-avid right upper-lobe primary lung malignancy with hypermetabolic right paratracheal nodal metastasis (consistent with at least N2 disease).
2. Numerous FDG-avid osseous metastases consistent with Stage IV disease.

extractions.extraction_text: EXAMINATION: Whole-body fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) PET/CT
CLINICAL INDICATION: Staging of newly diagnosed non-small-cell lung carcinoma (NSCLC)
COMPARISON: None available

TECHNIQUE: Following a 60-minute uptake period after intravenous administration of 12 mCi of FDG, low-dose non-contrast CT images were obtained for attenuation correction and anatomic localization, followed by emission PET images from the skull base to mid-thigh.
A 3.1 cm spiculated mass in the right upper lobe demonstrates intense FDG uptake (SUVmax 12.4).
Ipsilateral mediastinal (station 4R) lymph node measuring 1.2 cm shows increased activity (SUVmax 6.8).
No contralateral mediastinal or hilar hypermetabolic nodes.

Multiple focal areas of increased FDG uptake are seen in the axial and appendicular skeleton corresponding to sclerotic lesions on CT, compatible with osseous metastases (largest in right iliac bone, SUVmax 9.1).
No abnormal activity in the liver.
No abnormal activity in the adrenal glands.
No abnormal activity in the brain.
Physiologic tracer distribution in myocardium.
Physiologic tracer distribution in kidneys.
Physiologic tracer distribution in urinary bladder.

1. FDG-avid right upper-lobe primary lung malignancy with hypermetabolic right paratracheal nodal metastasis (consistent with at least N2 disease).
2. Numerous FDG-avid osseous metastases consistent with Stage IV disease.

sample_whole_body_petct.text:
EXAMINATION:

Whole-body fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) PET/CT

CLINICAL INDICATION: Staging of newly diagnosed non-small-cell lung carcinoma (NSCLC)

COMPARISON: None available

TECHNIQUE: Following a 60-minute uptake period after intravenous administration of 12 mCi of FDG, low-dose non-contrast CT images were obtained for attenuation correction and anatomic localization, followed by emission PET images from the skull base to mid-thigh.


FINDINGS:

Lungs: A 3.1 cm spiculated mass in the right upper lobe demonstrates intense FDG uptake (SUVmax 12.4).

Mediastinum/Hilar: Ipsilateral mediastinal (station 4R) lymph node measuring 1.2 cm shows increased activity (SUVmax 6.8). No contralateral mediastinal or hilar hypermetabolic nodes.

Bones: Multiple focal areas of increased FDG uptake are seen in the axial and appendicular skeleton corresponding to sclerotic lesions on CT, compatible with osseous metastases (largest in right iliac bone, SUVmax 9.1).

Liver: No abnormal activity in the liver.

Adrenal Glands: No abnormal activity in the adrenal glands.

Brain: No abnormal activity in the brain.

Heart: Physiologic tracer distribution in myocardium.

Kidneys: Physiologic tracer distribution in kidneys.

Urinary Bladder: Physiologic tracer distribution in urinary bladder.

IMPRESSION:

1. FDG-avid right upper-lobe primary lung malignancy with hypermetabolic right paratracheal nodal metastasis (consistent with at least N2 disease).
2. Numerous FDG-avid osseous metastases consistent with Stage IV disease.
